msDesc.head: Theological composite manuscript. A) (fols vi–70) Germany (?), s. xiiiex/xivin; B) (fols 71–82) Avignon, 1343; C) (fols 83–97) Germany, s. xiiiex/xivin; D) (fols 98–109) Avignon (?), c.1343; E) (fols 110–121) Southern France, s. xivin; F) (fols 122–135) Mainz Charterhouse, s. xvin; G) (fols 136–168) Mainz Charterhouse, s. xvin

physDesc.p: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 664–686. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

supportDesc.foliation: i–vi, 1–171; (fols 1–70) in modern (19th-cent.) pencil; (fols 71–171) in a different (20th-cent.) hand
supportDesc.collation: A) i 1+10 | ii 10 | iii–v 12-2 | vi and vii 10; B) viii 12; C) ix 6 | x 12-3; D) xi 12; E) xii 12; F) xiii 10 | xiv 4; G) xv 1+8 | xvi–xviii 8

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.

history.provenance: William Laud, 1573–1645: The present book consists of seven fascicles, which were likely put together only in the course of the Laudian binding. Ex-libris inscription, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 1r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 175–6 Quarto Catalogue, col. 177 Quarto Catalogue, p. 551 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 35

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 664–686

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Laud Misc. 203 – Part A (fols vi–70)

msItem.title: Theological treatise
msItem.note: Fragment of a work of scholastic theology, for full description see printed catalogue. First line affected by trimming.

msItem.title: Quaedam notabilia magistri Hugonis (de S. Victore?)
msItem.note: Unidentified theological treatise.
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt quedam notabilia magistri ugonis quot bona facit tribulatio
msItem.incipit: Sancti martires multa passi sunt tormenta ut ad ipsorum exemplum
msItem.explicit: inferius quod dedit caleph ase. filie. | Siccine. sic etiam numquid sic. Spiritus dei malus arripiebat saul ... dicta ab hamo.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling (fols 1r ff.) in hard point, one column of 22 or 23 lines. Ruled space
c.145–50 92–97

handDesc.handNote: Textualis (German?), s. xiiiex/xivin, by a single hand. Fragment (item 1) written on both sides in German textualis, s. xiii, by a single hand. Annotations in hands from the Mainz Charterhouse, s. xiv or xv.

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: Annotations in Carthusian hands from Mainz (s. xiv or xv).

msItem.author: Hugh of St.-Cher
msItem.title: Expositio missae siue Speculum ecclesiae
msItem.note: With appendices (ed.: G. Sölch, in Opuscula et textus ... illustrantia. Series liturgica 9 (Münster, 1940), incl. the 1st appendix; – Franz, Messe, 474f.; Little 72; Glorieux, Rép., 2aw; Schneyer, Wegweiser, 342; Hauréau, Initia, 2. 41rb–va; Kaeppeli 1990, this copy (incorrect folio nos); Bloomfield 1589, and suppl.).

msItem.author: Ps.-Thomas Aquinas
msItem.title: De officio sacerdotis et de sacramentis ecclesiasticis
msItem.note: Abridged text (ed.: Hauréau, Notices et extraits, 1. 209, this copy; Little 194, this copy; Glorieux, Rép., 14ec; Grabmann, Geistesleben, 3. 335; Hauréau, Initia, 5. 89ra, this copy; Bloomfield 4719, and suppl.).
(fol. 82r) Colophon by Carthusian Iohannes Arfelt, dated 30 September 1343: 'completus per Iohannem Archfelt de Esche dyaconum. Avinonensem. in die beati Ieronimi. Sub Anno domini. mo ccco xliijo.’

supportDesc.support: parchment; (fol. 71) remnants of a bookmark, now broken off.
supportDesc.collation: viii 12. At the end of quire viii, at the bottom centre of fol. 82v: ‘12’, in lead point.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in lead point, one column of c.38–47 lines. Ruled space
c.173–86 112–14

handDesc.handNote: German textualis cursiva with features of bastarda, by a single hand: Iohannes Arfelt, who completed the text on 30 September 1343 in Avignon, see the colophon on fol. 82r (item 4).

history.origin: 1343 France, Avignon : written by Iohannes Arfelt and completed on 30 September 1343 (see the colophon on fol. 82r). The fascicle appears to have originally been larger, see Collation.
history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: Parts B and D written by Johannes Arfelt de Eschwege, who is also responsible for other manuscripts associated with the Mainz Charterhouse.

msItem.author: Hugh of St.-Cher
msItem.title: Expositio missae siue Speculum ecclesiae
msItem.note: With appendices, see item 3. Text shorter and varies from ed.

msItem.author: Adam of Aldersbach
msItem.title: Summula Raymundi
msItem.note: Redaction B, excerpts (without prologue) (pr.: GW 212–217, here compared with GW 213; – Walther, IC, 9117, citing the present MS., incorrect folio nos; Schulte, GQ, 2. 427f.; Franz, Messe, 482–86; Kaeppeli 3; Bloomfield 2668, and suppl.).

msItem.author: Ps.-Bernard
msItem.title: Planctus Mariae
msItem.note: (pr.: GW 4055–60; 3906; ed.: R. A. Q. Skerrett, ‘Two Irish translations of the Liber de passione Christi’, Celtica 6 (1963) 82–117, citing the present MS. at p. 82 (incorrect folio no.); ed. at pp. 85–114; F. J. Tanquerey, Plaintes de la Vierge en Anglo-Français (XIIIe et XIVe siècles) (Paris, 1921) 6, this copy (incorrect folio no.); RAM 28 (1952) 243–66, this copy at p. 261, n. 58 (incorrect folio no.); Mohan 352*).

supportDesc.support: parchment; remnants of medieval repair (stitching holes). (fol. 95) The lower outer corner restored with a parchment patch, before the text was inserted.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in ink and lead point, two columns (fol. 96: one column) of c.44–47 lines. Ruled space
c.157–70 110–17

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xiiiex/xivin, by several hands. Annotating hand (fol. 83r) also wrote in MSS Laud Misc. 478 (C) and Laud Misc. 192.

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the hand annotating on fol. 83r is also seen in other Laudian manuscripts associated with the Charterhouse.

msItem.author: Ps.-Bernard
msItem.title: Floretus
msItem.note: With prologue and epilogue (pr.: GW 3996–4002, 3951; with commentary GW 4004–4013, with commentary by Jean Gerson GW 4014–4019; ed.: Hauréau, Bernard, 43–45; Walther, IC, 11943; Hauréau, Initia, 4. 145vb–146rb, this copy at fol. 145vb; Bloomfield suppl., 3236a; Rudolf, Ars moriendi, 59f.; cf. Stegmüller, RB, 9085).

msItem.title: Elegy 'Vado Mori'
msItem.note: (cf. Hauréau, Initia, 6. 318vb, citing the present MS. only; Bloomfield 6312, this copy; Rudolf, Ars moriendi, 49–51).

msItem.title: Verses
msItem.note: 9 moral verses by Henry of Langenstein, PS.-Bernard of Clairvaux and others unidentified. Verses itemised in printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Lapidarius: Virtutes lapidum
msItem.note: (Thorndike and Kibre 955, citing the present MS.).

msItem.title: Lapidarius
msItem.note: (Thorndike and Kibre 475, citing the present MS.).

msItem.title: Verses
msItem.note: Moral verses by Serlo of Wilton and others unidentified.

supportDesc.support: parchment; (fol. 109) bookmark, glued to the outer centre, now lost.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in lead point, two columns of c.37–55 unruled lines. Ruled space
c.177–86 125–33

handDesc.handNote: German textualis cursiva with features of bastarda, by a single hand: Iohannes Arfelt, see part B.

history.origin: 1343 France, Avignon. Written in the hand of part B: Iohannes Arfelt, c.1343.
history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: Parts B and D written by Johannes Arfelt de Eschwege, who is also responsible for other manuscripts associated with the Mainz Charterhouse.

msItem.author: Hugh of St.-Cher
msItem.title: Expositio missae siue Speculum ecclesiae
msItem.note: See item 3, text varies from ed.

msItem.title: Description of Rome
msItem.note: [Mirabilia Romae] (pr.: Hain 11174–88, etc.; ed. H. Jordan, Topographie der Stadt Rom im Alterthum, vol. 2 (Berlin, 1871) 605–43).
(fol. 120vb) De Urbe Roma; mainly elegiac couplets, lamenting the decay of Rome.

supportDesc.support: parchment; (fol. 110r–v) a rust stain at the lower outer margin, possibly from former binding furniture.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in lead point, two columns of 36 or 37 lines. Ruled space
c.140–44 95–100

handDesc.handNote: Southern French textualis, s. xivin, by a single hand. Annotating hands of s. xv, possibly from the Mainz Charterhouse.

decoDesc.decoNote: Coloured initials in red and blue with pen flourishings.

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the main hand resembles the hands seen in other French manuscripts from the Charterhouse, such as MSS Laud Misc. 221 and 738, for example. The hands which annotated the fascicle may well originate from the Charterhouse.

msItem.author: Henricus de Frimaria
msItem.title: Exposition of the Lord's Prayer
msItem.note: With preface and prologue (Stegmüller, RB, 3166; Zumkeller 321, citing the present MS., incorrect folio nos; Bloomfield 9071, this MS., incorrect folio nos).

msItem.title: Commentary on Ave Maria
msItem.note: This exposition is attributed to Henricus de Frimaria (Stegmüller, RB, 3169 and suppl., this copy; and 9987; Stroick, Friemar, 75; Zumkeller 291, citing the present MS., incorrect folio nos).

msItem.title: Articles of the Faith
msItem.note: (pr. Cologne 1474 (GW 12340), etc.; – Kaeppeli 2387).
(fol. 135v) Several notes, in different hands, s. xv.

supportDesc.support: parchment; (fol. 133) remnants of medieval repair (stitching holes).

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in lead point; one column of 27–41 unruled lines (fols 122r–134r). Ruled space
c.147–58 102–106

handDesc.handNote: Bastarda, s. xvin, in a single hand from the Mainz Charterhouse.

decoDesc.decoNote: Coloured initials in red and blue.

history.origin: Early 15th century Germany, Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael.
history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the text hand is from the Charterhouse; see also G) Provenance below.

msItem.author: Hugh of St.-Victor
msItem.title: De institutione nouiciorum
msItem.note: With prologue (ed.: PL 176. 925A–52B; ed. Goy, Überlieferung, 340–67, this copy at p. 356, no. 103 (incorrect folio nos); Bloomfield 4685, and suppl.; Glorieux, Migne, 68).
(fol. 136v) list of contents, on paper glued to the parchment leaf, written in a hand of s. xv from the Mainz Charterhouse.
(fol. 159v) Note in a hand of s. xv from the Mainz Charterhouse at the upper margin.

msItem.title: Theological treatise
msItem.note: De modo loquendi.

msItem.title: De Confessione
msItem.note: (Bloomfield 292 and 293, and suppl.; Kaeppeli 2782).

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De uisitatione infirmorum
msItem.note: Excerpts (ed.: PL 40. (in the range of) 1147–58; Rudolf, Ars moriendi, 60f.; Römer ii/1. 199 (no. 34); ii/2. 275).

supportDesc.support: parchment; remnants of former binding furniture (rust stains).

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in ink, one column of (fols 137r–164r) 25–29 and (fols 164v–168r) 33 or 34 unruled lines. Ruled space
c.145–50 101–105

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xvin, two hands: G1) (fols 137r–164r); G2) (fols 164v–168r) from the Mainz Charterhouse. The table of contents (fol. 136v) added in a different Carthusian hand from Mainz, s. xv. In the area of hand G1 sporadic annotations in a hand of s. xv from the Charterhouse, in small script (= hand G2?).

decoDesc.decoNote: (fol. 164v) blank space for an initial and guides to paraphs.

origin.origPlace: Germany, Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael, as evidenced by script.

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the 15th-cent. ex-libris inscription at the upper margin of fol. 137r: ‘Iste liber est Carthusiensium prope magunciam’. The list of contents on fol. 136v was inserted by a Carthusian hand of s. xv, from Mainz; for full listing, see printed catalogue. The works listed do not form part of MS. Laud Misc. 203, except for items 21 and 22 of part G, and, probably, items 16–18 of part F. The list suggests that fascicle G was originally much larger. Hand G2 is Carthusian, from Mainz, possibly also hand G1.

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
